definition.@value: Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) is a severe X-linked myopathy caused by mutation in the dystrophin gene with symptoms appearing before the age of 6 with a rapid disease progression. Symptoms may include fatigue, learning difficulties (the IQ can be below 75), Muscle weakness, problems with motor skills, frequent falls and progressive difficulty walking.

longDefinition.@value: Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) is a severe X-linked myopathy with symptoms appearing before the age of 6 with a rapid disease progression (differentiating it from other forms of muscular dystrophy). Duchenne muscular dystrophy occurs in about 1 out of every 3,600 male infants. Symptoms may include fatigue, learning difficulties (the IQ can be below 75), Muscle weakness, problems with motor skills, frequent falls and progressive difficulty walking.

label.@value: Autosomal recessive muscular dystrophy, childhood type, resembling Duchenne muscular dystrophy
severe childhood autosomal recessive muscular dystrophy
Symptomatic form of Duchenne muscular dystrophy in female carriers
